raw_body: This addendum to the GPT-5 system card shares a new model: GPT-5-Codex, a version of GPT-5 further optimized for agentic coding in Codex. GPT-5-Codex adjusts its thinking effort more dynamically based on task complexity, responding quickly to simple conversational queries or small tasks, while independently working for longer on more complex tasks.
speedrun: The latest update introduces GPT-5-Codex, an enhanced version of GPT-5 designed for coding tasks. This model can quickly handle simple queries while dedicating more time to complex problems. Its ability to adjust thinking effort based on task difficulty marks a significant step forward in AI coding capabilities. This matters now as it could improve efficiency for developers and streamline coding processes.
why_it_matters: Developers could benefit from faster responses to simple coding tasks, enhancing productivity.
This update indicates a shift towards more adaptive AI tools, potentially reshaping how coding is approached in the industry.

lenses.eli12: Think of GPT-5-Codex as a student who knows when to quickly answer easy questions and when to spend time solving tougher problems. This flexibility means it can help everyday users with coding tasks more efficiently. For anyone working with technology, this improvement could make learning and using coding tools much easier.
lenses.pm: For product managers and founders, GPT-5-Codex represents an opportunity to enhance user experience in coding applications. By addressing both simple and complex tasks effectively, it could reduce development time and costs. This means teams could focus more on innovation rather than getting bogged down in routine coding challenges.
lenses.engineer: From a technical perspective, GPT-5-Codex optimizes its processing based on task complexity, allowing for quick responses to simple queries while engaging in deeper analysis for complex coding tasks. This dynamic adjustment could lead to improved performance metrics in coding efficiency. However, engineers should monitor its responses to ensure accuracy in more nuanced scenarios.
